results.title: Grand prix
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Joel Productions, Cherokee Productions, Edward Lewis and John Frankenheimer
results.brief_description: A race day accident involving Jordan-BRM teammates Pete Aron (James Garner) and Scott Stoddard (Brian Bedford) leaves Stoddard critically injured. During Stoddard’s recovery, Aron becomes involved with his wife (Jessica Walter) who seems determined to leave Scott. At the same time, drivers Jean-Pierre Sarti (Yves Montand) and Nino Barlini (Antonio Sabato) also have chronicled love affairs with Louise Frederickson (Eva Marie Saint), an American journalist, and Lisa (Francoise Hardy). Music by Maurice Jarre. Academy award winner for best editing, sound and sound effects.

results.title: Grand Manan
results.brief_description: The people of Grand Manan, New Brunswick, derive their living from the abundance of fish—cod, haddock, herring, hake and sardines—which inhabit the Bay of Fundy.

results.title: Grand illusion = Le Grand illusion (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Jean Renoir’s great anti-war film, set in a German prison camp for officers in 1917, with Erich von Stroheim as the commander. A subtler work than most more recent variations on the theme. In French with English subtitles.
results.description: Jean Renoir’s great anti-war film, set in a German prison camp for officers in 1917, with Erich von Stroheim as the commander. A subtler work than most more recent variations on the theme. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Grand illusion = La Grande illusion
results.brief_description: Jean Renoir’s classic study of men in war. The German victor and his captive officers in the close proximity of the prison camp become strangely impacted by the ironic contradictions of their situations. A deep respect develops between the German commander and his captive French officer, inter- woven with each other’s obligations to country and fellow-man. Cast includes Erich von Stroheim and Jean Gabin.

results.title: Grand Hotel
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Irving G. Thalberg and Edmund Goulding
results.brief_description: The Grand Hotel is a luxurious hotel in Berlin, a hive of activity where lives and futures are altered. Based on the novel by Vicki Baum, “Grand Hotel” features a formidable line-up of players - Greta Garbo as a lonely, aging ballerina, John Barrymore as the Baron and a gentleman thief, Joan Crawford as a street-wise stenographer, Wallace Beery as a vicious, lustful tycoon and Lionel Barrymore, a doomed man hoping for a last glorious fling at the “Grand Hotel”. Winner of an Academy Award for Best Picture, 1932.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Irving G. Thalberg and Edmund Goulding

results.title: Grand Central Market
results.creator_credit: United States Information Agency and William Hale
results.brief_description: In the city of Los Angeles, California, is a large central food market catering for the needs of its large population. This film shows the mixed population of the area shopping in an atmosphere of freedom and friendship.

results.title: Grampa's sci-fi hits
results.creator_credit: Amvest Video, Bertram Siegelson and Peter Zasuly
results.brief_description: Grampa Munster, one of the most popular stars from the 60’s television series “The Munsters”, presents a selection of movie trailers from famous and less prominent science fictions films. Trailers featured include: Flash Gordon (1936), Flash Gordon’s trip to Mars (1938), Flash Gordon (1980), Godzilla (1956), Destroy all monsters (1968), King Kong (1933), Alien (1978), Barbarella (1968), Rocky Horror Picture Show (1975), Dr. Goldfoot and his girl bombs (1966), Buck Rogers (1978), Omega man (1971), Fahrenheit 451 (1966), The Blob (1958), 30 ft. bride of Candy Rock (1959), Village of the giants (1965), The Amazing colossal man (1957), Godzilla vs. Megalon (1976), Ghidra, the three headed monster (1964), Varan the unbelievable (1962), Reptilicus (1961), Atragon (1963), Creation of the humanoids (1962), Battle of the worlds (1961), Earth vs. the flying saucers (1956), This Island Earth (1954), The Day the Earth stood still (1951), and Lost world (1960).

results.title: Grampa's monster movies
results.creator_credit: Amvest Video, Bertram Siegelson and Peter Zasuly
results.brief_description: Grampa Munster leads the viewer through an exploration of classic monster movie trailers. Trailers featured include: House of Frankenstein (1944), House of Dracula (1945), Son of Dracula (1943), Dracula’s daughter (1936), Dracula (1931), The Invisible man returns (1940), The Invisible woman (1940), Invisible agent (1942), The Invisible ray (1936), Frankenstein (1931), Frankenstein meets the Wolf Man (1943), Bride of Frankenstein (1935), The ghost of Frankenstein (1942), Abbott and Costello meet Frankenstein (1948), Phantom of the opera (1943), The Climax (19??), The Werewolf of London (1935), The Mystery of Marie Roget (1942), Murders in the Rue Morgue (1932), Flesh and fantasy (1943), The Wolfman (1941), The Mummy (1932), The Mummy’s hand (1940), The Mummy’s curse (1944), The Black cat (1934), The Cat creeps (1946), Black Friday (1940), and Horror island (1941).

results.title: Grain structure
results.creator_credit: Merton Park, Frank A. Hoare and Robin Cantelon
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Structure and Properties of Steel”.
Explains how grain structure and grain size in steel are affected by its carbon content the way in which it is worked and its heat treatment. Indicates also how properties of hardness, ductility and tensile strength are due to differences in its internal structure.

results.title: Grain elevator
results.creator_credit: Wayne Finucan Productions and Charles Konawal
results.brief_description: Basic film about the workings of an old family style grain mill, a one to two man operation. One hundred and fifty box cars per year of grain are provided from about 100 small farmers.
